str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly. From para and the base of aggelos; to transmit a message, i.e. to enjoin.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.
From ana and pipto; to fall back, i.e. Lie down, lean back.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From eucharistos; to be grateful, i.e. to express gratitude; specially, to say grace at a meal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To break (in pieces), break bread. A primary verb; to break.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and tithemi; to place alongside, i.e. Present; by implication, to deposit.
And, even, also, namely.
